name: Sushant Acharya
body:
### Publications
================
1. **Costly Information, Planning Complementarities and the Phillips Curve**    
    *Journal of Money, Credit and Banking (Forthcoming)*     
    Available as [NY Fed Working Paper 698](https://www.newyorkfed.org/medialibrary/media/research/staff_reports/sr698.pdf)

### Working Papers
==================
1. **Rational Inattention in Hiring Decisions** (with [Shu Lin Wee](https://sites.google.com/site/shulinwee/))   
    [Latest Version](https://github.com/sushantacharya/sushantacharya.github.io/blob/master/mainRI.pdf)   

2. **Escaping Unemployment Traps** (with [Julien Bengui](https://www.webdepot.umontreal.ca/Usagers/benguij/MonDepotPublic/), Keshav Dogra and [Shu Lin Wee](https://sites.google.com/site/shulinwee/) )   
    [Latest Version](https://github.com/sushantacharya/sushantacharya.github.io/blob/master/ABDW.pdf)

3. **Liquidity Traps, Capital Flows** (with [Julien Bengui](https://www.webdepot.umontreal.ca/Usagers/benguij/MonDepotPublic/) )    
    Available as [NY Fed Working Paper 765](https://www.newyorkfed.org/medialibrary/media/research/staff_reports/sr765.pdf?la=en) and [CIREQ Working Paper 14-2015](http://www.cireqmontreal.com/wp-content/uploads/cahiers/14-2015-cah.pdf)    
Latest Version Coming Soon (Under Revision)

4. **Asset Price Effects of Peer Benchmarking: Evidence from a Natural Experiment** (with [Alvaro Pedraza](http://www.worldbank.org/en/about/people/alvaro-pedraza))    
Available as [NY Fed Working Paper 727](https://www.newyorkfed.org/medialibrary/media/research/staff_reports/sr727.pdf)    
[Latest Version](https://github.com/sushantacharya/sushantacharya.github.io/blob/master/AssetPrices.pdf)

5. **Dispersed Beliefs and Aggregate Demand Management** (under Revision)  

### Work in Progress
====================
1. **Sentiments: Anything Goes?** (with [Jess Benhabib](https://sites.google.com/site/jessbenhabib/) and [Zhen Huo](http://zhenhuo.weebly.com/) ) 

2. **Changing Sentiments and Exchange Rate Predictability** 

3. **The Optimal Quantity of Safe Assets** (with Keshav Dogra)
